item.description:
The Lynn Woods Reservation is the second largest municipal park in the country, encompassing over 2,220 acres. Offering many points of interest as well as varied, often challenging terrain.


What's the plan?

We will do a counter clockwise loop around the perimeter of the Reservation. This will cover a lot of ground allowing us to see a good deal of Lynn Woods. The hike will be approximately 7 to 9 miles in length and will include scrambling over rough terrain with some elevation gain. We will maintain a fast pace, finishing the hike in approximately four hours. While this hike is not as challenging as the 4000 footers in the White Mountains, you will NEED TO BE CARDIO FIT to come on this hike. If you cannot maintain a two to three mile per hour pace for several hours, this hike is not for you.


Where will we meet?

We'll meet at the Pennybrook Road entrance to the reservation, there should be plenty of parking.

Official address for the Pennybrook Road entrance:

106 Pennybrook Rd
Lynn, MA 01905


What should I bring?

- Water (2 liters at least)
- Good hiking shoes/trail runners
- Bug spray
- Snacks
- Camera (never know when a photo opp will happen).


More Information

Rain will cancel, I'll send out a message the night before if there is any change of plan.

Official Lynn Woods Reservation web site
http://www.ci.lynn.ma.us/citydepartments_lynnwoods.shtml

Map of Lynn Woods Reservation on the Friends of Lynn Woods Site
http://www.flw.org/maps.html
item.name: Let's explore the Lynn Woods Reservation
